instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  low voltage  No lights on charger.
threads.message:
Hello. I am working on a MBA 829-00165 and as I check the power rails I only  get a 4.1 volts at <RESISTOR>R5450</RESISTOR>  Shouldn't this be 8.6 volts?

My problem is that I have no lights on the charger. It seems like I have <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  low voltage  No lights on charger.
threads.message: It seems like you have 3V42? It seems to me you need to make sure before anything else. Also inspect <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> area for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  low voltage  No lights on charger.
threads.message:
This board is actually very clean. no signs of liquid damage at all. 

I have 3.42v everywhere along the rail. <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 8, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> pin 13m <CHIP>U3740</CHIP> pin1, <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> pin 9, <CAPACITOR>C4820</CAPACITOR> pin1, L5001 pin1, <RESISTOR>R5127</RESISTOR>, <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> pin 3 and 1, L7095, <RESISTOR>R8141</RESISTOR> pin 1, 
When I get to <CAPACITOR>C7095</CAPACITOR> I have 3.45V on pin 1 but only 1.3V on pin 2

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  low voltage  No lights on charger.
threads.message: Any ideas at all? Thank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  low voltage  No lights on charger.
threads.message: checking the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> rail.  At the fuse F7140. I have 8,3v on pin 1 and 1.9v on pin 2. This doesn't make sense since I can't see a direct short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  low voltage  No lights on charger.
threads.message: 8.3V is too low and it seems like F7140 is blown? SMC is not running. Check <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>. Corrosion under SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  low voltage  No lights on charger.
threads.message:
Hmm. I replied Sunday morning but For whatever reason it didnt post. 
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL>  checked <RESISTOR>R2072</RESISTOR> pin 2 0v 
<RESISTOR>R5170</RESISTOR> pin 1 3.4v
<RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> pin 1 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>  <CAPACITOR>C5003</CAPACITOR> pin 1 3.4v  <CAPACITOR>C5009</CAPACITOR> pin 1 3.4v

<SIGNAL>SMC_BIL_BUTTON_L</SIGNAL> <RESISTOR>R5181</RESISTOR> pin 1 3.42v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  low voltage  No lights on charger.
threads.message: Seems like an SMC issue to me. Either SMC is dead or there is corrosion under/around it.
